intro: Turnera fasciculifolia, commonly known as the golden trumpet or yellow turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Turnera fasciculifolia is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
